meta.title: NSR Construction — Tunnel Formwork (Production & Supply across CIS)
meta.description: Production and supply of tunnel formwork across the CIS. Support, training, service. NSR Construction.

hero.title: Tunnel formwork production and supply across the CIS
hero.subtitle: A modern technology for fast, durable construction: pouring walls and slabs in one cycle and smooth surfaces with less finishing work.

card1.title: Tunnel formwork: walls + slabs in one cycle
card1.text: Cuts timelines and improves repeatable quality: a monolithic structure in one pouring cycle.
card1.li1: • Simultaneous pouring of walls and slabs

card2.title: Seismic resistance: a monolithic “capsule”
card2.text: Pouring integral structures forms a reinforced-concrete “capsule” — earthquake resistance and durability.

card3.title: 500–700 cycles + high-strength steel
card3.text: Long service life and wear resistance — designed for intensive use across multiple projects.

about.title: Company / numbers
about.subtitle: NSR Construction was founded in 2024 and focuses on producing and supplying modern locally manufactured formwork systems for construction needs.

stats1.label: FOUNDED
stats1.text: Our goal is modern, high-quality formwork systems to speed up projects and improve build quality.

stats2.label: IMPLEMENTATION RESULTS
stats2.text: Residential area built using the technology at customers’ sites.

stats3.label: BUILT
stats3.text: Suitable for multi-storey monolithic construction and high-strength requirements.

params.title: Inputs for an accurate quote
params.subtitle: To provide price and delivery schedule, we need project parameters and logistics. The more accurate the input — the more accurate the quote.

row1.v: Residential complex / Multi-storey monolith / Serial construction

row2.v: Typical floor plan, floor height, wall/slab thickness

row3.v: City/country, start timeline, unloading conditions, truck access

card1.title: What can you send instead of a full spec?

item1.s: PDF/screenshot is enough for an initial estimate.
System composition and quantities for your project.

kit.title: Tunnel system + service package
kit.subtitle: This section focuses on the tunnel system and project support.

card1.title: Tunnel system
card1.li1: Panels: sets for a typical floor (walls + slabs) with modular sizing.
card1.li2: Connections: locks/fasteners for repeatable assembly each cycle.
card1.li3: Supports & safety: stability elements and geometry control.

card2.title: Surface quality
card2.li1: Smooth walls: no plaster needed (putty is usually enough).
card2.li2: Consistency: same quality across cycles and floors.
card2.li3: Construction pace: faster floor handover and less downtime.

card3.title: Support / training
card3.li2: First pour support: we help you start without mistakes.
card3.li4: On-site assistance: tailored technical help on details.

faq.title: FAQ: production & supply
faq.a1: We deliver across CIS countries. Support is provided regardless of the country or project region.
faq.a2: Support, training and service: assembly control, first pour support, contractor training and individual technical assistance on site.
faq.q3: How smooth are the walls after tunnel technology?
faq.a3: Walls are smooth and usually don’t require plaster — putty is enough. This reduces costs and speeds up finishing.
faq.q4: How many cycles does the system last?
faq.a4: Designed for 500–700 pouring cycles and made from high-strength steel — durable and wear-resistant.

footer.blockText:
Production and supply of tunnel formwork across the CIS.
Support, training and on-site service.
